attributes.action: Sieze the London Flats of Nawaz Sharif ex PM Pakistan and send him to Pakistan
attributes.additional_details: The National Accountability Bureau (NAB) later found that Sharif had acquired four apartments in Avenfield House, a luxury apartment block close to Hyde Park in London. It is those properties that are due to be confiscated, according to the verdict.
attributes.background: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif has been sentenced to 10 years in prison and handed an £8 million ($10.5 million) fine over corruption charges related to his family's purchase of overseas properties, dealing a blow to his party's prospects ahead of a general election later this month.

rejection.details:
The UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for seizing assets of crime. This would be the responsibility of law enforcement agencies, such as the Crown Prosecution Service and the courts, which are independent of the Government and Parliament.

You could start a petition about something that UK Government and Parliament are responsible for.
